name: YOTEL New York at Times Square West

reviews.text: Yotel was clean and good value for the location, but some of the mod looks sacrificed simple functionality. The shower drained onto the bathroom floor creating an uncomfortable puddle, the bed was hard as a rock because of no boxspring, the lights and window shades were hard to work, and our reservation had a glitch when we checked in. The lobby is a row of computers which makes it feel impersonal. That being said, it was clean and a good value for the proximity to Times Square. I wouldn't stay there for more than one night because of the uncomfortable bed and how awkward the modern service and atmosphere was. Depends what you like, but yotel is pretty much a watered down version of The W hotel.
reviews.title: Too Mod? Maybe.

reviews.text: I stayed at Yotel for four nights with my friends and we had a really good experience. I expected to place to be cool but it was even better than I imagined. I didn't know before we arrived that the bed doubled as a sofa and the it had an electronic motor to move it back into being a bed. This was really cool to play with. The best thing I found about the hotel was the staff, they were all very helpful and friendly but it didn't feel put on like it does in some hotel where they are just looking for a tip. I would definatly recommend staying here to anyone. I think it is probably best suited toward younger people but everyone would felled welcomed never the less. Thank you Yotel for a great stay. P.S thanks NE Pats for beating the Jets and making the trip even better, had to fit that in.
reviews.title: Go Yo!

reviews.text: great space, staff and location. great value. stayed there for 1 night on business. very comfortable space and location.
reviews.title: yotel ny

reviews.text: The best way to get ready for work is with your own music playing. Well these rooms have ipod plug ins. I loved this room. I also loved the free coffee on each floor.
reviews.title: ipod heaven

reviews.text: In general the hotel is very nice and the location is great (10 mins from times square). It is a little bit crowdy thro the weekends since they have arrange parties on the 4th level club you won't hear any noise in your room but the staff can be preoccupied with people who came for the party (but hey if you like a good party the entrance for hotel guest is for free).
reviews.title: Stayed during the weekend of Nov 11 2011

reviews.text: Hotel was modern and had a great hip vibe, rooms were very clean and in great location 3 blocks from times square. Mission control is the center of the hotel and could pay more attention to staffing levels for customer needs. Overall would recommend this hotel for low maintenance travelers.
reviews.title: Great up and comer, great themed hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights the end of June. We were very pleased with the location, the price, the staff. The room was small, but it was not claustrophobic. We found the bed to be quite comfortable. There were lots of staff ie two to four at street level, and the Mission Control desk was well staffed as well. In fact, we seemed to see employees everywhere, and I believe all were friendly. The continental breakfast is a bit of a misnomer, as it consisted of coffee and muffins, but that is a small complaint. We did not eat in the restaurant, however we visited the patio bar, and it is beautiful. Overall, I thought the service was great, and would certainly stay again.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: When you check into this hotel, you do it by yourself on a computer screen, it was quite quick and efficent. The room isn't too big but it isn't small like a shoebox either. We had a great view of New York from our room. The beds were quite modern and electric!! Had a nice tv and an ipod dock which was quite handy. Also there was free breakfast (mainly muffins) and free wifi. Great trendy place to be at!!
reviews.title: Modern, funky hotel

reviews.text: Imagine the latest Japanese University Dormitory where the students sleep in tiny cabins and the entire place is run by problematic computers and the staff is counting the minutes till they're off. Now imagine a tiny white room where the width of the room is so narrow that a futon-like bed must be electronically extended for sleeping, blocking access around the tiny room. Now imagine a mattress so thin you can feel the very fibers that pathetically make up its filling. Welcome to Yotel... motel.
reviews.title: So Hip it Hurts - Like a Japanese Dorm Room (in a bad way)

reviews.text: This new New York entry is a painful attempt at cool, cheap and chic. I would only recommend this hotel to those wanting to experience college dorm life one more time. It all begins at check in where a bank of touch screen computers are supposed to check you in and give you a key card. Unfortunately nearly all the stations were out of commission and check in was moved to an annoyed young woman in a dark corner of the ground lobby space. Nearby there is a nifty robotic arm that stores luggage in a wall of drawer-like compartments that I believe are a nod to the rooms.
reviews.title: Modern hotel in good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Heated towel rack, 2. espresso/ coffee on your floor 24/7, 3. great food choice and price in Hell's Kitchen, 4. two blocks to Hudson River, bicycle rental and Manhattan cruise, 5. great subway and bus access, 6. largest cafe terrace in Manhattan to hang out, 7. close to Broadway shows and Birdland jazz club, 8. great bed, 9. iphone/ ipod dock
reviews.title: minimalistic best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy walk to times square and subway stations. Room is very well sound proofed. We spent most of our time touring, having a small room was no issue at all. Happy hour bar service was pretty poor, interesting how some one can ignore you when they are standing right in front of you. This was our 3rd trip to NY, I will return again to this hotel next time.
reviews.title: Great location, very comfortable.

reviews.text: Great concept hotel. Fantastic value and service. Micro sized rooms, but everything you need
reviews.title: Pleasantly different

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here for 5 nights! The location and the price was great. Yotel has a great feel and the service was spot on. Our only regret was we missed the Sunday brunch, we only caught the last 1/2 hours and it had a great atmosphere, the music was great!! We met the owner of the hotel who kindly recommended places to go around new York in which we did. we were delighted because they were all great!
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.text: A memorable trip!
reviews.title: Amazing yotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at Yotel for 4 nights, and we had a terrific time!
reviews.title: Great location, great staff, all over a great stay!

reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted by the staff immediately who helped us with the luggage and the check-in. We arrived at 11am and got to check-in right away, without any additional costs.
reviews.title: I love the terrace & lounge !
Poor value for money
reviews.text: We got the room at the highest floor, and had read earlier that the room was a bit cramped. But we found it quite nice. It had luggage space under the bed, and it was a sofa that would convert to a bed, so you would have more room to move around. Many has had something to say about the bed, and yes, it's firm. But after a while you get used to it. We always got a good night of sleep. The bathroom was no problem for us, despite it only being a curtain that separated it from the "bedroom". So, if you're not too comfortable with your significant other while doing your business, there are toilets on the 4th floor as well.
What is also a plus is that on every floor they have a galley where you can get ice, free coffee, hot chocolate and there is a microwave and soda machine there too.
reviews.title: New-aged, fun!

reviews.text: The only negative things I have to point out is that there is no door/showercurtain/wall between the toilet and shower, so the floor in front of the toilet gets wet when you shower. But they always provide a towel you can lay on the floor.
reviews.title: Loving it, cool hotel!

reviews.text: Really loved this hotel everything that you need was there, rooms where small but that wasnt a problem. The toilet has a glass and a courtin so if u are shy it might be a problem but that's the only problem the food was lovely! It was such a nice hotel we stayed a extra night
reviews.title: Very funky great location . Everything at hand

reviews.text: Having been to New York a couple of times previously, we wanted a central base to allow us to see all the sights and obviously not pay too much. We got all that and ALOT more with Yotel. It is simply a fantastic concept hotel with so many quirky ideas that I can't even begin to explain. For starters, it's on 42st about a 5min walk from Times Square so u couldn't really be more central. The rooms are great, fully making use of the space with the sliding bed being the incredibly comfortable highlight! The staff were friendly and always on hand to help, the bar was lively and the roof terrace looked amazing (although being march and therefore a bit cold, we only looked on in admiration!). I can imagine in the summer it being spectacular. All this for a very reasonable room price. I can't wait to visit the next city that Yotel opens up in, the package works and must be a success.
reviews.title: Great idea, well executed in prime location

reviews.text: Add to your list now!!
reviews.title: Great New Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say the Yotel far exceeded my expectations. I expected cramped quarters, the rooms are by design, small, yet so well layed out that it feels much larger. The amentieis are awesome, staff was busy yet friendly. I've found a new home in New York City.
reviews.title: Great Value, Modern and Chic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying here within the first month of its grand opening. For the price and location, this hotel cannot be beat.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Yotel is hip and modern and cool and everything else you've been reading here. The rooms are small but well organized. I definitely would have gotten claustrophobia if staying here more than a day or two. Luckily we only stayed here one night. I say luckily because it was impossible to sleep! First of all, the bed which looks really neat is hard as a rock. I like a firm mattress but this was more like sleeping on a slab of marble. No way to get comfortable in that thing. Also the noise is a problem as we could hear every time someone came in or out of their room, which was constantly all through the night. You can also hear everything going on in the halls...lots of talking. There are many nice touches and the staff was terrific but I found myself wishing I could go home in the middle of the night....which I definitely would have done if I didn't have plans for the next morning. But I don't think most of the guests were here for a good night's sleep.
reviews.title: If sleep is not a priority...

reviews.text: The location is great. The rooms are fabulous and clean. I was in a small cabin so I wouldn't recommend it for more than 2 people and the way the bathrooms are made, hopefully you're very comfortable with each other. The bedding and linens are of good quality. Theirs a club lounge on the fourth floor for those looking to party. It's not a family oriented hotel in my opinion but it is a good location at an affordable rate and it's walking distance to times square.
reviews.title: A futuristic hotel taking self-service to new heights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel cannot be faulted, great location, reasonable charges per night and spotlesly clean. Have stayed in several hotels in NY but the Yotel is the best. The rooms are small but compact and have everything u need. Staff are very nice and helpful
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Yotel for 6 nights on our first trip to NYC. The location is very convenient to Times Square and Hell's Kitchen. It is very funky and different. The staff were all very knowledgeable and friendly. The place is very clean and tidy at all times. The only real downfall is that the other guests seemed intent on slamming their doors at all hours. Soft closers on the doors would be nice. A door on the toilet room would be bonus too!
reviews.title: Cool Hotel, great location

reviews.text: First off i couldnt stop posting pics of this hotel on FaceBook...now I all my FB friends wanting to stay there!!!!!! I love that its only a few blocks from Time Square!!!!! Yo I had a ball...my husband and I also had a nice romantic evening on the patio thingy!!!!!!
reviews.title: Simply Purplicious!!!!!

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel a total of 18 nights so far this year on 3 different occasions. I find the hotel itself to be clean and economically designed, a fun place to stay. I particularly like the corner queen rooms which have lots of windows and a great view.
reviews.title: Fun hotel, worthless Mission Control staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The crew on the main floor are mostly terrific and very helpful, and actually seem to do the most work at the hotel. Housekeeping also seem to be on top of things and kept my room tidy and stocked with towels. The crew at the front desk on the Mission Control floor, however, are worthless. Good luck getting them to welcome you, help you with enthusiasm or even smile! Always seem to be three of them at the desk, none of them doing much except looking down at their keyboards or gossiping to each other (Simone in particular). Don't think I didn't make their manager aware of them.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel! Loved it!

reviews.text: It's also a bit frustrating that there is no room service at this hotel. There are a couple of restaurants on the Mission Control floor which are nice but it's inconvenient not to be able to phone down for breakfast or something.
reviews.title: Welcoming staff, excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall though, I do still recommend this hotel. It's trendy and fun, and a good value for the price. If good customer service can be introduced and maintained, it'd be my preferred choice every time!
reviews.title: GREAT FIRST TRIP TO NYC

reviews.text: Yotel was an excellent hotel. The location is perfect, id say a 5 min walk and your in Times Square. Ignore the comments about an uncomfy bed it was lovely and cosy. The rooms/cabins are extremely clean, the design is very modern and stylish. It was nice to get hot drinks and muffins for free in the morning as ive stayed in New York 3 times now and never had anything for free, it just gets you started for the day. The staff are really friendly and are more than happy to help with any questions. The self check in was cool, very easy to use. I dont see why people have moaned about this, its so easy to use we had no problems at all. It is 2011 technology is very advanced now, an who wants stand in a line waiting for recpetion anyway I want to check in and go an see New York. Overall fantastic hotel and would tell my friends and family to stay here if they go to New York too :) x
reviews.title: Yotel is great for business travelers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the Yotel right at check-in time, 3pm. We went right to the kiosk where someone walked us through how to check in. However, the machine wasn’t working and didn’t print our receipt or room keys so we were sent to Mission Control.
reviews.title: Great Location but would not stay again

reviews.text: We stayed in a room on the 14th floor.
reviews.title: Awesome location, exactly what I expected and great valuel for money!

reviews.text: Room: The room is small, but we expected this. It wasn’t so small that we felt on top of each other the whole time. The rooms have nice flat screen TVs in the wall and storage in the bathroom and around the bed. The bathroom is strange, as others have noted. There is a curtain separating the main room and bathroom. The toilet/shower area does have a door but it is a glass door that doesn’t offer any privacy. This wasn’t a big deal for us but if I were traveling with someone I wasn’t that close to, I may be a bit shy about it! I loved the shower head.
reviews.title: Good for friends traveling on a budget

reviews.text: The shower got the floor very wet because of the lack of a door. I didn’t mind the smell of the shampoo/body wash as others have noted.
reviews.title: Fresh and nice

reviews.text: The shower leaked into the room… I guess the seal of the shower wasn’t installed correctly. It got the curtain, the carpet and my clothes that were on the floor next to the bed soaked. This will probably cause mold in the near future!
reviews.title: Horrible News!!!!

reviews.text: I've been in New York many times in my life and stayed at many hotel in New York and many other cities in the world and I can say that I loved this hotel and will definitely stay again. The cabins were very cozy, clean and just what I needed. The staff were wonderful as well. I loved the location in the city too.
reviews.title: Great atmosphere and concept !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Omar- Las Vegas
reviews.title: Short Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has an excellent location, offers great prices, and has friendly employees. The executive view cabin I reserved was spacious and had a beautiful view with NW exposure of the river and looking uptown. I was with my partner and it wasn't awkward having a transparent sliding door to the restroom (and we usually don't groom or use the toilet together). There were different lighting options in the room and we could plug our music directly into the speaker system there. The bed faced the windows and the TV was to the side, which we preferred and if someone wants to watch TV it is on a mobile wall mount. I was able to use the refrigerator in the shared galley to store some perishable items that I purchased. The mission control staff were friendly and extremely helpful. If possible, they would have provided me with early check-in. They also offer late check-out for those interested.
reviews.title: Yotel nyc

reviews.text: I dropped my wallet in a taxi on nye and was hysterical. Nori helped my partner and I cancel credit cards in Australia because we were both very emotional. Her assistance was very professional, courteous, helpful and friendly. My wallet was returned which is extremely rare but what is also rare is the high level of customer service that we received from Nori. Thanks Yotel & Nori. Heath & Amy - Melb Australia.
reviews.title: Have a Purple day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Innovative self check in system in the lobby where they have people to help. Rooms are in the style of an aircraft cabin. Rooms are compact but function well. Reception area on level 4 is spacious, but low level purple lighting makes it impossible to read any written material.
reviews.title: Perfect place!

reviews.text: A great value that's extremely convenient to the Javits Center. I've stayed twice and will continue to stay here when attending conferences.
reviews.title: The only hotel if you're going to the Javits Center.

reviews.text: -The public spaces are bright, clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: So so great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Rooms are funky and functional
reviews.title: yotel fab nyc hotel

reviews.text: -Check-in takes two minutes. Really.
reviews.title: Welcome to the Ihotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Staff is very helpful.
reviews.title: Good location and a place with style
Great location clean hotel
reviews.text: Definitely different but if you know you're staying in a ship cabin type room then you won't be surprised. The room was super clean and smelled fresh. The only thing that's a little weird is using the rest room when someone is in the room. They will hear everything. There is no room for luggage so unpack and store your bags in the lobby with the robot. The reason I chose this hotel was the price, distance to Times Square, and the parking available on site. The parking is significantly cheaper than any garage in the area so if you're planning a road trip to New York City than this hotel is the place to stay. Staff is ok some shine brighter than others. There's a young man named Arben who is especially helpful. He gave us directions and advice on what to do or see. He remembered my name which is rare this day in age. I will definitely stay here again. Good for young couples may be a little too different for those used to traditional comfort hotels.

Stayed there for 4 nights with my hubby on our first visit to NYC, Yotel only 10-15 min walk from Times Square! The room was small & cabin-like (which we were expecting) but who goes to New York to spend time in their room?? The staff were helpful, the room was immaculate, the bed was comfy & the galley kitchen on each floor provided free coffee & hot chocolate :)
reviews.title: Fabulous location

reviews.text: On the negative side there's not a lot of privacy with a sliding glass panel for a toilet door & a curtain to divide the room! Not a big issue for us but depending who you were going with might be awkward! Also the "monsoon" shower was definitely more of a light drizzle, always nice n hot tho And the Yotel shower gel smells amazing!!
reviews.title: Top hotel! Would definately stay again! 10/10

reviews.text: We would absolutely return to this hotel & hope to do so very soon :)
reviews.title: Great location,very modern

reviews.text: We (a young couple) stayed in yotel for 5nights for NYE. I couldn't recommend this hotel enough. Upon arrival the hotel face/entrance exudes modernity. A swift and easy self service check in brought us to the 25th floor with a lovely partial view of the hudson river. A clean, comfortable, small yet efficiently used space awaited us. Although the bathroom is only separated from the room by a white curtain it didn't bother us at all however you would want to be somewhat comfortable in the company you're in! Some may consider it expensive (NYE nights was $500 alone) although this is the norm for NYC and ESP at that time of year. Great location, short stroll from times square. Staff were very polite and friendly. Especially the cleaning staff..I never got their names but they gave loads of info on locations for shopping etc and were extremely helpful :-) I was a little apprehensive after reading some reviews about the beds saying they were very hard but I slept soundly every night!
reviews.title: Great value and location

reviews.text: I recently spent 7 nights at Yotel NYC and could not give this hotel a high enough rating!
reviews.title: Yotel - you won't be disappointed!

reviews.text: As a solo traveller - the cabins were the perfect size. Compact but still provided enough room to make you feel comfortable. I had a cabin on the 17th floor with a view including the Empire State Building.
reviews.title: Modern, comfortable & good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check in process is quick, easy and understandable.
reviews.title: Hip Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping did a great job everyday - my cabin was in perfect condition every afternoon when I returned to the hotel as it was when I first checked in.
reviews.title: Does exactly what it says on the tin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The galleys on each floor with included hot chocolate, coffee and tea were exactly what I needed after spending a winters day out and about in NYC.
reviews.title: A nice NYC hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel futuristic concept was great. The rooms are noisy, maybe it is because of the wall material or the door material that is not thick enough. Big party sceneat night at the bar. Not what I was looking for.
reviews.title: Futuristic but noisy rooms

reviews.text: The location is great. A bit pricy for me but its worth it.
reviews.title: Great place,great location!!!!

reviews.text: I tried it once but do not think I would stay here again.
reviews.title: The hippest hotel you will ever find, Yo!

reviews.text: Upon arrival this was everything like I've read about.Super fast checking on the ground floor with plenty of helpfull staff around at all times.You then go in the lift up to Four.Mission control,the lounge,the bar,the restaurant,meeting booths & access to the outdoor terrace are all on this level.I never needed mission control for anything but they'll help getting transfers to the airport or tickets to shows if needed.From Four you get into another lift(there's four lifts)up to which ever floor you are on.Theres a galley on each floor with microwave,fridge,cold water & crushed ice dispenser & a hot drinks machine which are all free to use at any time of the day.The rooms are spotless with everything you could need.Soap dispenser at the sink & two in the shower so no need bringing your own adding to the weight in your case.Theres a hairdryer,iron + ironing board great tv with iPod connection and the bed can be made into a sofa at the touch of a button.Free wifi & air con aswell.When checking out if you've got time to spare before your flight as we had then you can leave your bags or cases with the Yobot a fancy robot on ground level.Our cases were to big in height so the porter took them off upstairs for use while we made the most of our remaining time in this wonderful city.The guys on the ground level will hail you a cab but this really is only a 10 min walk into times sq.Go out the hotel doors turn right then right again.Also if you want the subway then you'll pass the port authority subway on the way to times sq.Also if you get chance go to TIMES SCARE down in times sq.If you love scary movies & don't have a weak heart you will love this place.Also the Magican there is awesome he got to the semi finals of Americas got talent.His name is Dan Sperry!Hope you have a wonderful time like we did!!!!
reviews.title: A triumph of style over substance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Get away from the Times Square tired chains and go a couple blocks west to the Yotel for an unforgettable stay!
reviews.title: anniversary at the Yotel in New York...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Yotel this month. We picked it b/c it was one of the cheapest options in Manhattan and it looked pretty cool. We were not disappointed! The room was amazing--small, but we never felt squished or cramped. The features (t.v., shower, bed, etc.) were fantastic.
reviews.title: Best Hotel We've Ever Had!

reviews.text: The location was excellent. In the 4 days that we stayed in Manhattan, we never once took a cab. We walked to Times Square, Central Park, a few shows, and everywhere else. The subway was cheap and we saved a ton on transportation costs b/c of the Yotel's location.
reviews.title: Make sure the air conditioning works in your "cabin"

reviews.text: However, the best part of the hotel was the staff. I've never stayed at a hotel with such friendly, outgoing people. I had more conversation with staff people than ever before--I remember Jose, the always-smiling guy who helped with our luggage. He went out of his way to say hi to us (and it seemed all the staff did the same thing). They offered great tips on the neighborhood and were simply amazing.
reviews.title: Tiny Rooms, But Nice and Fun

reviews.text: If my wife and I ever go back to New York, we will definitely stay at the Yotel again. Don't miss it--for $150/night, it was well worth it!
reviews.title: Although I live in NYC, It was a Vacation to Visit Yotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went up to 80 degrees in our room. Waited till we were both so sick to call down and they fixed it. New hotel, they decided to polyurethane the floor in main lobby, eating dancing area on a Saturday night?? The fumes were unbelievable!!! They offered me 37 dollars back to compensate???? Should have comped me the room. Sleepless in manhattan
reviews.title: Great staff - nice hotel

reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed 4 nights at Yotel end Oct/beg Nov 2011. It was a fantastic location. Our room was exceptionally clean as was the rest of the hotel. Great staff - bell boys were full of info about sightseeing and shopping tips. We had free muffins, coffee & tea at breakfast but bought breakfast at the hotel and a few other place in Times Square - this saw us through to dinner. There were free beverages from gallery on every floor including decaf coffee:-)). WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND YOTEL!!!
reviews.title: FANTASTIC...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here overnight while in NYC for a wedding. We were driving up from Washington, DC and had to be ready for a 3pm wedding. Since check-in isn't until 3pm, my husband called to request early check-in. Long story short ... we were able to check-in early ... but only after 5 separate phone calls, being told we could always change for the wedding in the hotel restroom, and one conversation with a very rude and dismissive hotel employee. Otherwise, the room was small but clean. The bed, although not the most comfortable one we've ever slept on, was just fine. The bathroom is very open (sheer curtin, no door, glass shower) so if you want/need privacy this is not the bathroom for you. The location is great - only a few blocks from Times Square. Overall, for the price and location it was a great hotel. We just wished the customer service could have been better.
reviews.title: Great location, price ... less than great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 4 nights in november and the view from our window was spectacular when the eventually came out! We were close enough to everything we walked nearly everywhere. The staff were brilliant always said hello and goodbye when you were passing were close by to help with check in, luggage robot etc. The room was very clean, the beds were reasonably comfortable, the bathroom was a little awkward not having a door but we worked with it, the views were worth it! We helped ourselves to muffins and drinks in the morning which are complimentary. All in all we had a great trip!
reviews.title: Brilliant views and location

reviews.text: Stayed at yotel for my 40th birthday in mid October.
reviews.title: Amazing futuristic hotel!

reviews.text: Checked in via screens in lobby and helped by a friendly staff member. They took our bags to our room on the 21st floor and showed us how the gadgets worked and explained about breakfast and the galley. The galley was a room which had complimentary tea coffee and hot chocolate. Breakfast was served from floor four - mission control at 7am. Only muffins and coffee or tea but it was free so that was a bonus!
reviews.title: Great Midtown Spaceship

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first trip to NYC and we originally booked the standard "cabin". However, once we were there we decided to upgrade to a corner room which was $50.00 + tax a night. Considering the views in NYC it was well worth the extra $ in my opinion. The men standing in the lobby were very nice in letting us know that in order to upgrade we needed to go to the fourth floor, speak to "mission control", and they would take care of it. I do recommend upgrading your room before you arrive because we did get the last corner room available. I believe these rooms are also slightly larger. There was a closet area with space to hang clothes, two drawers, plenty of room under the bed for large suitcases, iron, ironing board, safe, small hair dryer, and small toilietries such as tissues, and disability access. There is a TV, desk, IPod dock, automatic blinds, and plenty of shelves to make for storage. I never really had any issues with the hotel, but here are some things that others may potentially find annoying. Corner rooms are located right next to the "Galley" where you will find the free coffee, water, fridge, microwave, and ice. Good because I slipped by for my morning cup in my PJ's a couple of times. Bad, because like many others have said, you can hear the door slamming shut time after time as people are going in and out. If you are a light sleeper this may be really bad for you. The bed is super hard and I would say it has less cushion than a futon. I was always sooo tired from the streets of NY that it never bothered me, but anyone with back issues would never make it. The bathroom had two issues. I read about a curtain covering the restroom, which was not the case for corner rooms. We had no curtains seperating us, just the clear sliding door. I have been in some not so private bathrooms in my time traveling, but this was the worst. This door does not have any frost at all, it is completely see through, and has a small dotted design at the bottom, which does nothing privacy wise. I just can't understand this concept of hotels and why they think it is desirable to watch someone else go to the restroom. Just be warned that the door is clear and you can see through it. The other thing with the bathroom was the draining of the shower. We had to put down at least two towels to keep from getting water all over the floor and into the carpet. I believe this causes huge problems with mold because I am allergic to it and felt very symptomatic while there. The first morning we got out fairly late around 1:00 PM and when we returned around 8:00 PM our room was not clean (the only time this happened for 5 nights), but around 30 mins later we got a call from mission control that when they came by that we had our "do not disturb" sign on and they were unable to clean the room and asked if we needed any extra towels or anything else they could help us with, which I thought was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Corner room review

reviews.text: On the fourth floor you will find two bars. We did hang out for two drinks on a Sat around 7 and the bar was fairly busy. We had no problem getting a drink and they are pricey like every other bar in Manhatten. There is an outdoor area rooftop as well, which we never used because of the weather, but would be great in the summer. The area they turn into a night club atmosphere at night is also on four. We passed by several times, but never went in because I am not a huge fan of techno which it seemed that they only played. Dohyo is also located on four, they supply the free muffins from 7-10AM there, there are several computers to use free of charge, and a concierge. "Yobot" is located in the lobby when you first walk in, but be aware that it can NOT store all luggage. Luckily one of the doormen told us our bags were too big and he was kind enough to store them for us, and arrange for a taxi once it was our time to leave. Yotel also has there own car service that they use where you can ride in a black town car or escalade for an upgrade charge if you want to ride VIP. We never used it, but I thought it was cool that they had it as an option.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay in NYC

reviews.text: Overall, our stay was great for what we paid to stay there, there is a fairly young crowd staying here (20's-30's), the best thing about this hotel is LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!! There is a CVS 24 hour pharmacy right across the street good for any late night munchies or snacks, a subway is also across the street. Times Square is a two block walk. Subway and bus stations are all really close by. There are a lot of food options all around. Broadway shows are within walking distance. We are walkers and we were able to walk to Rockefeller Plaza, Fifth Ave, Grand Central Station, and Central Park from the hotel with no problem. There are always cabs around to catch and there were never any outrageous fees over $30 (accept La Guardia, around $32) getting anywhere we needed to go in Manhatten. I would totally stay there again and I fell in love with NYC.
reviews.title: Very Affordable in a Prime Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our group of seven gals on a weekend experience to NYC LOVED the Yotel. It added to our NYC experience. We enjoyed the atmosphere, the friendly staff, and the overall accommodations! The gallery was so nice to have in the evening when we returned to the hotel--a cup of hot chocolate on a cool evening! There were several eating places near the Yotel--walking distance. We walked to the theater, subway, Times Square, etc. The group all stated they would return to the Yotel. Although the hotel advertised the rooms were compact--they were excellent. The features that were new to us, no check in desk, the beds, made the experiences even more fun! We thought we were the only ones in the Yotel--so quiet. When we returned late at night--we were pleasantly surprised by the security outside and inside the Yotel. No additional charges for the gallery, printing of boarding passes, etc. Thank you Yotel!
reviews.title: Amazing hotel

reviews.text: I previously stayed at the Yotel in London Gatwick and was pleasantly surprised with that experience. Thought this would be a great experience for my 3 sons while in NYC as I didn't want to stay with family.
reviews.title: Chic, hip, modern and fun. Love the concept.

aka: Yotel New York At Times Square West Hotel New York City
description: YOTEL is a first class hotel experience at an affordable price. Check in is all about efficiency, with kiosks that are your digital receptionist where you confirm your booking and grab your room key. The Midtown NYC hotel's 669 cabins offer guests a beautifully designed, flexible smart space to suit individual needs to relax, refresh, connect, and sleep. On the hotel's main level, FOUR, you will find Mission Control, a futuristic, fully equipped concierge desk for one stop service 24/7. Also on FOUR is a restaurant, an outdoor terrace space, a deluxe lounge and bar with private meeting rooms, a state-of-the-art gym, a flexible studio and boardroom for a range of events, a unique lounge space for working or relaxing, and work stations to catch up on email or browse the web. YOTEL serves a complimentary breakfast including coffee, tea, and assorted muffins and whole fruit. Guests can also enjoy complimentary hot beverages on each floor, as well as free Wi-Fi and domestic calls. Conveniently located near Times Square, this Midtown Manhattan hotel provides business and leisure travelers with easy access to New York City attractions, corporate offices, and much more.
